channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for AZ
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for AZ

item.title: Report X-2024030932
item.description:
Report X-2024030932

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-25T15:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-14
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS FOUND INSIDE OF VAN WITH THE BOX OPEN AND THE BOTTOM OF THE PLASTIC DRUM SPLIT IN THE SEAM AT THE BASE CAUSING THE POWDERED CHLORINE TO SPILL DescribePack: THE BOTTOM OF THE 5GAL PLASTIC DRUM BUSTED OPEN AT THE SEAM AS IF TOO FULL. THE CHLORINE WAS IN A PLASTIC BAG THAT TORE OPEN. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE CHLORINE WAS SWEPT UP AND EVERYTHING WAS PLACD IN A PLASTIC HAZMAT BAG AND THEN PLACED IN A HAZMAT TOTE. EVERYTHING WAS THEN MOVED TO THE QA REPACK STATION.

item.title: Report X-2024030728
item.description:
Report X-2024030728

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-25T15:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-08
  • City: TEMPE
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: X-2024030728: SequenceEvent: Package was found in a truck leaking, QA was notified and was moved to a lined HazMat tote with orientation labels up. DescribePack: Loose caps caused the inner containers to leak and damage the outer packaging. DurationRel: 6 and MitigateEffect: Package was taken out of the truck and placed into a lined HazMat tote with orientation label up to stop and further leaking. X-2024030731: SequenceEvent: Package was found leaking in a truck, QA was notified and placed into a lined HazMat tote with orientation labels up. DescribePack: Loose caps caused the inner containers to leak and damage the outer container. DurationRel: 6 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed into a lined HazMat tote with orientation labels up to prevent further leaks.

item.title: Report X-2024030732
item.description:
Report X-2024030732

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-22T18:13:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-08
  • City: TEMPE
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found leaking during the loading phase, QA was notified and package was placed into a lined HazMat tote with orientation labels up. DescribePack: Loose caps caused the inner container to leak and damage the outer container. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed into a lined HazMat tote with orientation labels up to prevent further leaks.

  • Description: ABF stated as they were breaking the trailer and noticed the carton was wet and noticed what was on the trailer floor had been there for a while. ABF thinks this was punctured when being loaded at 165/SNB. The spill is contained in the trailer and Cura is being called for dispatch.

  • Description: RESPONDER RECEIVED A CALL FOR A LEAKING PACKAGE IN THE UNLOAD WALL. UPON ARRIVAL RESPONDER IDENTIFIED SAID LEAKING PACKAGE, PLACED SAID PACKAGE IN SPILL TRAY FOR TRANSPORT, AND TRANSPORTED TO DMP AREA FOR PROPER DISPOSAL.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was discovered inside a trailer with no visible damage on the first flap leaking out of the bottom. DescribePack: 1.5-inch crack on the bottom left corner of the frontside of plastic bottle. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: package was places in a bag inside a red storage plastic container.

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: From what we know either the spill occurred and the HESS wasn't complete or the hazmat wasn't shipped as the weight on the label is informing us. DescribePack: I wasn't able to find any holes and or punctures on the steel drum. DurationRel: 2000 and MitigateEffect: I don't know what to mitigate when their appears to be no sign of any contents in the drum.

item.title: Report X-2024021918
item.description:
Report X-2024021918

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-21T15:13:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-22
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: BNSF Mechanical identified a possible release from top of car while switching. Graymar Env was mobilized to inspect and identified two man way swing bolts requiring 4 full rotations to secure. Shipper notified once release was confirmed. Release has been secured for continued movement.
